reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfortable beds, clean spacious room & a great location. Owners were friendly & helpful. Blueberry muffins were great. Just a few minutes from restaurants, shops & the Cabot Trail. Would def stay again.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at Merry's.Based on TA reviews it seemed the best option in Cheticamp.Rooms are simple but adequate and very clean. Suzanne was very pleasant and helpful when we checked in. It was very good value as a breakfast of toast and muffins with preserves,tea or coffee and apples and bananas was included in the price.The owner 'hovered' around us whilst we were eating which was a bit disconcerting.
reviews.title: Basic but clean and good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Merry's Motel is set behind the B&B, and easy to miss unless you are looking carefully. The picture on the website does not really show that the motel is across the street from the ocean, and the B&B blocks the view of the middle units. The double room we had was spotless, with very basic furnishings. Beds were hard, and the walls were thin. Thankfully, our neighbors went to bed fairly early. The room is very bright, even at night, as the windows only had thin cotton curtains, so if you need a dark room, stay elsewhere. The friendly owner served us homemade blueberry muffins with coffee or tea, and fruit for breakfast. A good value for the price, but not sure if I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Clean, basic choice in Cheticamp

super clean
reviews.text: The price was reasonable, the room and bathroom spotless, the owner friendly. The floor in our room was hardwood rather than carpet, which helps reduce the dust mites.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Merry's Motel for 7 days this month. I picked this place because of the excellent reviews on this site. I was not disappointed. Understand that Cheticamp has a slew of small motels and B&Bs. If you're looking for a good, clean, basic room and a very helpful owner, this is the place. One day at breakfast someone asked Susan if she knew about TripAdvisor, and she said yes but had one complaint--the "average price" doesn't necessarily reflect the price during high season. We paid $80 per night and considered it a bargain.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: After staying at a couple of dumpy and dated motels, we were relieved to arrive here and find a lovely motel! The room was bright and immaculate, the mattress and bedding were very nice. We sat outside in the 2 Muskoka chairs and enjoyed a drink! Susan, one of the proprietors is a charming hostess! The continental breakfast was simple, yet enjoyable.
reviews.title: Lovely!

likes.liked: — Reasonably priced, complimentary breakfast, clean room, close to Cape Breton National Park

reviews.title: Friendly and Inviting
reviews.text: For a small motel that offers complimentary internet, TV, and a light breakfast; I am impressed. Susan and Martin are two wonderful folks who manage both the motel and the B&B.

This hotel looks older from the outside but was as excellent as many Trip Advisors have said that it is. It is operated by two Swiss ex patriots and is one of the cleanest hotels or motels that I have ever stayed in. It is located in Cheticamp, just outside the spectacular Cabot Trail in Nova Scotia so it is somewhat remote but the town is interesting from a historical prespective. We went to LeGabriel restauant just up the street for dinner and were impressed. Merry's has an excellent continential breakfast. Beds were comfortable. No pets or smoking. Less than $100 Can total for a wonderful motel as long as you aren't looking for a place with a pool and facilities (after a long day in the National Park, the comfortable beds were most appreciated).
reviews.title: A hidden gem

reviews.text: We stayed for a couple of days in the B&B section using the hotel as a base for our Cape Breton Highlands NP visit. We stayed at rooms 9 for us the parents and the adjacent room 10 with two single beds for the kids. The rooms are located on the second floor of the main building (the motel accomodations are behind the main building). When #9 and #10 are booked together, you have the entire floor with the washroom that only these rooms have access to and a private lounge on the first floor with TV, many books in many languages and a fridge.
reviews.title: Exceptional service, cleanliness and value at Suzanna's place
Excellent motel with interesting friendly owners
reviews.text: Suzanna is an exceptional host, knowledgeable about the area, service oriented and also very smart and interesting to talk to. The place is run with Swiss effectiveness and is spotlessly clean (the owners are from there after after all).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best value in Cheticamp and may be the entire north Cape Breton. We ended up at Merry's by chance after having received a very poor quality of service from Keltic Lodge in the other side of the national park (a review of this is found somewhere below). We are very happy that we landed at Merry's -- not only have we met a great person, but we saved a bunch too. Our visit to the Lodge for dining purposes only confirmed that our choice was right even though the two places are not supposed to compete in the same league pricewise, Keltic Lodge's management have a lot to learn from the Swiss couple about hotel business.
reviews.title: A good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive making a booking at Merry's Motel as I could not find any pictures on the web of the rooms, but booked anyway due to the overwhelming positive reviews. When I called to make the reservation, I learnt the owners were Swiss, and my experience of the Swiss told me the rooms would be spotlessly clean. As I expected, the room was immaculately clean, and very comfortable for a small independent motel in a small town. Their rates are very reasonable. Some reviewers have commented breakfast is light - this may be true as it's not bacon and eggs etc., but is totally adequate with bread/toast, muffins, coffee and tea. Their bread is from Boulangerie Aucoin, a local bakery 5 minutes drive away, and was so wonderfully fresh it'd be a sin to toast it - eat it fresh! If you're not in a hurry in the morning, engage Susanne the owner in some conversation during breakfast - she has led an interesting life and has some interesting colourful stories to tell, and is quite entertaining.
reviews.title: Friendly owners
